snippet: Opera, of all the art forms, is singularly associated with food, whether because of the appetites of well-girthed singers or the sensual pleasures celebrated in its music.
abstract: Food is associated with opera perhaps more than any other art form and singers regularly eat and drink on stage. Photos (M)1
lead_paragraph: HANSEL and Gretel stuff pastries into their mouths, topping them off with toasted gingerbread witch. Leporello pours out a fine Marzemino wine from northern Italy for Don Giovanni, then nibbles at a piece of pheasant. Schaunard calls for Rhine wine, roast venison and dressed lobster for his fellow Puccinian Bohemians at the Café Momus in Paris. And that's just a sample of this season's menu at the Metropolitan Opera.

headline.main: Don't Sing With Your Mouth Full
